Uses of Class
graph.GraphException

  • Packages that use GraphException 
    Package Description
    graph
    graph package: a collection of classes for representing graphs, hyper-graphs and algorithms operating on such discrete finite structures.
    graph.coarsening
    package defines abstract classes and implements algorithms for coarsening graphs.
    graph.partitioning
    Package defines interfaces and implements algorithms for graph and hyper-graph partitioning.
    utils
    utils package: containing useful classes and methods including I/O manipulation.

      return the Set<IntSet nodeids> of all sets of nodeids with the property that they are independent (maximal) and at distance at most 2 from each other within the set they are in.
      java.util.Set Graph.getAllConnectedLinks(int k)
      computes *all* maximal subsets of arcs in this Graph with the property that any two arcs in a set s that is returned are at a distance one from each other.
      java.util.Set Graph.getAllConnectedNodes(int k)
      return a Set<Set<Integer nodeId> > that is the set of all sets of nodeids in the result set that have the property that are maximal sets of nodes that are connected with each other with at most 1 hop.
      double[] Graph.getAllShortestPaths(Node s)
      return the shortest path costs between Node s and all nodes in this graph, where the cost of a path is measured in terms of link weights adding up, and all link weights are assumed non-negative.
      double Graph.getCliqueLabelSupport(java.util.Set nodes, Graph g)
      get the support of a clique of this node in the other Graph g, in terms of their labels.

      get the complement of this (assumed undirected) Graph.

      construct and return the dual of this graph.
      Graph[] Graph.getGraphComponents()
      return all maximal components of this Graph as an array of new Graph objects.
      int HGraph.getHNodeIdByLabel(java.lang.Object label)
      get the id (in [0,num_nodes-1]) of the node whose label is the given argument.
      java.util.Set Graph.getNborIds(java.util.Set nodeids)
      return all node ids of the nodes that are immediate neighbors of any of the nodes whose ids are in the input set argument, excluding the nodes in the input argument set.
      int Graph.getNodeIdByLabel(java.lang.Object label)
      return the id of the node whose label is passed in the argument label (if it exists, otherwise throw GraphException)
      double Graph.getShortestPath(Node s, Node t)
      return the shortest path between Node s and Node t, where the cost of a path is measured in terms of link weights adding up, and all link weights being assumed non-negative.

      returns true iff each node w/ id in the arg.

    • Uses of GraphException in graph.coarsening

      Methods in graph.coarsening that throw GraphException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract void Coarsener.coarsen()
      the main method of this class.
      void CoarsenerIEC.coarsen()
      coarsen() performs the following loop until the number of unmatched nodes is less than a ratio of the original nodes: (1) we visit an unvisited node randomly; (2) we match it with the neighbor that yields the maximum value of arcs connecting weight * lamda + (1-lamda)*sum_of_weights_of_arcs_conn_common_nbors (3) we mark as visited both nodes that were matched of course.
      void CoarsenerIREC.coarsen()
      coarsen() performs the following loop until the number of unmatched nodes is less than a ratio of the original nodes: (1) we visit an unvisited node randomly; (2) we match it with the neighbor that yields the minimum value of arcs connecting weight (3) we mark as visited both nodes that were matched of course.
      abstract void HCoarsener.coarsen()
      the main method of the class.
      void HCoarsenerIEC.coarsen()
      coarsen() performs the following loop until the number of unmatched nodes is less than a ratio of the orinigal nodes: (1) we visit an unvisited node randomly; (2) we match it with the "best" neighbor according to the result of the method getBestNbor(id); (3) we mark as visited both nodes that were matched of course.
